content.question:
A reversible reaction at standard conditions has a negative enthalpy change (<math alttext="delta H naught is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mo>°</mo><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math>) and a positive entropy change (<math alttext="delta S naught is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mo>°</mo><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>). Which of the following must be true for the equilibrium constant, <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math>, and the standard cell potential, <math alttext="E naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi><mo>°</mo></math>, for the forward reaction?
<math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math><math alttext="E naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi><mo>°</mo></math>AGreater than 1PositiveBGreater than 1NegativeCLess than 1PositiveDLess than 1Negative

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
